subject: Technology
title: Starlink and Satellite Internet
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Starlink and Satellite Internet.

hook.text: Four billion people still lack reliable internet. Cables simply cannot reach every village.

buildup.text: Traditional satellites orbit far away, causing slow connections and frustrating lag.

discovery.text: SpaceX launched Starlink: thousands of small satellites orbiting much closer to Earth.

twist.text: Astronomers worry the swarms will ruin the night sky with streaks of reflected sunlight.

climax.text: For the first time, someone in a remote village can get broadband as fast as someone in New York.

punchline.text: Satellites might close the digital divide from space.

quiz.question: What makes Starlink different from traditional satellites?
options: Thousands of small satellites orbit closer to Earth
